isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SPICER 13-INCH (310 MM) AND 14-INCH (350 MM) ANGLE-RING SINGLE PLATE PUSH-TYPE CLUTCH - INSTALLATION

step1.para: Insert the clutch disc alignment tool or splined main driven gear through the clutch disc hub and into the flywheel pilot bearing to position the disc.

note.para: When installing the driven disc assembly, be sure to have the longer end of the hub rearward to the transmission.

step1.para: Mount the clutch to the flywheel with Grade 8 capscrews. 13-inch (310 mm) clutches use 12 screws; 14-inch (350 mm) clutches use 8 screws.

Tighten the clutch mounting capscrews evenly, and in the sequence shown in Figure 4, to the values found in the TORQUE CHART
.

figure.caption: Figure 4. Tightening Sequence for Clutch Mounting Bolts

step1.para: Remove the shipping blocks from between the tails of the levers and the flywheel ring of the clutch assembly. ( Figure 5). The clutch will not function unless the blocks are removed.

Re-install the transmission. Align it with the engine, then move it forward to enter the driven disc hub. Rotate the transmission input shaft slightly if necessary, to align the splines. Tighten the bolts to the value found in the TORQUE CHART
.

warning.para: Do not remove outside support from the transmission until it is completely bolted to the flywheel housing. Failure to do this can cause personal injury, or damage the driven disc hub.

figure.caption: Figure 5. Shipping Blocks in Clutch Assembly
